dueDate.description: the due date of the timer as Unix timestamp in millis.

elementInstanceKey.description: the key of the related element instance.

processDefinitionKey.description: the key of the process in which this timer was created

processInstanceKey.description: the key of the corresponding process instance

repetitions.description: the number of times this timer should trigger

targetElementId.description: The handlerFlowNodeID property represent the ID, from the BPMN XML of the process, of the flow node which will handle the timer trigger's event. In normal flow, this is usually the same as the related activity's ID, but when the timer was created due to a boundary event, it will be that event's ID.
